references.paper_title: Session-based recommendation with graph neural networks
references.reason: This paper is foundational to the field of session-based recommendation systems using graph neural networks, a highly relevant topic to link prediction.

references.paper_title: Clustering and preferential attachment in growing networks
references.reason: This paper introduces fundamental concepts of network clustering and preferential attachment, which are crucial to understanding link prediction in graph analysis.

references.paper_title: A new status index derived from sociometric analysis
references.reason: This paper introduces the Katz index, a fundamental heuristic for link prediction which is widely used as a baseline and compared against in modern link prediction methods.

references.paper_title: Friends and neighbors on the web
references.reason: This paper introduces the Adamic-Adar index, a significant heuristic measure used in link prediction, providing a foundation for various link prediction approaches.

references.paper_title: Semi-supervised classification with graph convolutional networks
references.reason: This paper introduces Graph Convolutional Networks (GCNs), a fundamental model in graph neural networks that forms the basis for many GNN-based link prediction methods.
